description: Epic Boon feats are available at 19th level or higher. When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature at 19th level, you can choose an Epic Boon feat instead.

feats.name: Boon of Combat Prowess
feats.description: You have mastered the art of combat:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Peerless Aim
benefits.description: When you miss with an attack roll, you can hit instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

feats.name: Boon of Dimensional Travel
feats.description: You can warp space around yourself:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Blink Steps
benefits.description: Immediately after you take the Attack action or the Magic action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

feats.name: Boon of Energy Resistance
feats.description: You have been infused with protective energy:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Energy Resistances
benefits.description: You gain Resistance to two of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your choices.

benefits.name: Energy Redirection
benefits.description: When you take damage of one of the types to which you have Resistance from this feat, you can use your Reaction to direct the damage to another creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your proficiency bonus plus your Constitution modifier) or take damage equal to 2d12 plus your Constitution modifier.

feats.name: Boon of Fate
feats.description: You can manipulate the strands of fate:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Fate's Call
benefits.description: When you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you succeeds on or fails a D20 Test, you can use your Reaction to roll 2d4 and apply the total rolled as a bonus or penalty to the d20 roll. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you roll Initiative or finish a Short or Long Rest.

feats.name: Boon of Fortitude
feats.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 40. In addition, whenever you regain Hit Points, you can regain additional Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Fortified Health
benefits.description: Your Hit Point maximum increases by 40.

benefits.name: Accelerated Healing
benefits.description: Whenever you regain Hit Points, you can regain additional Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Overcome Immunity
benefits.description: The Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage you deal always ignores Resistance.

benefits.name: Overwhelming Strike
benefits.description: When you roll a 20 on the d20 for an attack roll, you can deal an extra 2d12 damage of the same type dealt by the attack.

feats.name: Boon of Recovery
feats.description: You have an incredible ability to heal from injuries:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Last Stand
benefits.description: When you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead and regain a number of Hit Points equal to half your Hit Point maximum. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

benefits.name: Death's Defiance
benefits.description: You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws.

feats.name: Boon of Skill
feats.description: Your legendary competence is wondrous to behold:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Legendary Skill
benefits.description: You gain proficiency in all skills.

benefits.name: Skill Expertise
benefits.description: Choose five skills in which you have proficiency. You gain Expertise in those skills.

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Speed Increase
benefits.description: Your Speed increases by 30 feet.

benefits.name: Escape Artist
benefits.description: Immediately after a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

benefits.name: Hasty
benefits.description: When you take the Dash action, you can take it as a Bonus Action instead.

feats.name: Boon of Spell Recall
feats.prerequisite: Level 19+, Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature
feats.description: You can draw on deep wells of arcane power:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Free Casting
benefits.description: You can cast any spell you have prepared without expending a spell slot, provided the spell is 4th level or lower. Once you cast a spell in this way, you can't use this benefit again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

benefits.name: Spell Recall
benefits.description: When you finish a Short Rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your level (rounded down), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

feats.name: Boon of the Night Spirit
feats.description: You are one with the night:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Dexterity, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Darkvision
benefits.description: You have Darkvision with a range of 300 feet.

benefits.name: Merge with Shadows
benefits.description: While entirely within Dim Light or Darkness, you can give yourself the Invisible condition as a Magic action. The condition ends on you immediately after you take an action, a Bonus Action, or a Reaction.

benefits.name: Shadowy Form
benefits.description: While entirely within Dim Light or Darkness, you have Resistance to all damage except Force, Psychic, and Radiant.

feats.name: Boon of Truesight
feats.description: You have the all-seeing eyes of legend:

benefits.name: Ability Score Increase
benefits.description: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

benefits.name: Truesight
benefits.description: You have Truesight with a range of 60 feet.
